articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 6th in E
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 6th in E

An arpeggio is the notes of a chord played individually rather than simultaneously. In this case, we are focusing on the Minor 6th arpeggio in the key of E.

## Notes and Intervals

The E Minor 6th arpeggio consists of the following notes: E (root), G (minor 3rd), B (5th), and C# (6th). The intervals between these notes are as follows:
- E to G (minor 3rd)
- G to B (major 3rd)
- B to C# (minor 2nd)

## Musical Flavor and Genre

Arpeggios are often used to add a melodic and harmonic element to music. The Minor 6th arpeggio in E has a melancholic and emotional quality to it. It can be found in various genres such as jazz, blues, rock, and classical music. When played in E, it often evokes a sense of introspection and depth in the musical composition.

## Three Songs

Here are three songs that use the E Minor 6th arpeggio:
1. "Purple Haze" by Jimi Hendrix
2. "Autumn Leaves" (jazz standard)
3. "Black" by Pearl Jam

These songs demonstrate the versatility and emotional impact of the E Minor 6th arpeggio in different musical contexts.
